components.label: eligibleAmount

value = utils.custom.currencyFormatter((typeof data.assessment?.totalFederalAward === 'number' ? data.assessment.totalFederalAward : 0) 
        + (typeof data.assessment?.totalProvincialAward === 'number' ? data.assessment.totalProvincialAward : 0));

Application Number
components.content: Name: {{ data.fullName }} | Application Number: {{ data.applicationNumber }} | Study Dates: {{ data.offeringStudyStartDate}} - {{ data.offeringStudyEndDate}}

components.label: Content
components.content: Please note the funding you receive may differ from the eligible amount. The funding may be adjusted once confirmation of your outstanding principal balance of Part-time Canada Student loans and grants is received, or if any restrictions are added to your account after your initial assessment.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Your application was subject to federal and provincial assessment calculations based on Canada Student Financial Assistance Program and StudentAid BC policies. Your assessment is based on total family income as reflected in the previous year’s tax return (including spouse/common-law partner, if applicable), or as reported on your application if no tax return was available.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Total income used for assessment purposes: {{ utils.custom.currencyFormatter(data.assessment?.totalFamilyIncome) }}

components.label: HTML
components.content: Total assessed need = total costs - total resources

components.title: When your funds will be received Panel
components.label: Panel
HTML
components.content: When your funds will be received?

components.label: HTML
components.content: Funds may be received on or after the following date(s). Please note your actual disbursement date(s) may vary.

components.label: HTML
components.content: The earliest date you will receive funding.

components.label: HTML
components.content: The earliest date you will receive funding.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Before we can issue your Canada – BC integrated student financial assistance, you must first submit your master student financial assistance agreement (MSFAA) unless you have already submitted your MSFAA for a previous application. You will receive a 'Welcome Email' from the National Student Loans Service Centre (NSLSC) that includes a URL to register for an online account with the NSLSC where you will complete and submit your MSFAA using the 10 digit MSFAA number provided on this Notice of Assessment.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Please submit your new MSFAA number on NSLSC to receive your money.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Please submit your new MSFAA number on NSLSC to receive your money.

components.label: HTML
components.content: Please accept your assessment to move your application forward. Please ensure your banking information is up to date by logging in to your National Student Loan Service Centre account . If your banking information is not up to date, you may not receive your funding.

components.label: HTML
components.content: If you are not receiving funding, but are still attending school, you can contact your financial aid office for information about in-study payment-free status. If you do not want to move forward with this application, you can cancel using the "Cancel application" option.
